description: From Middle English forel (“case, sheath”), from Old French forrel, fourrel.

entries.meaning: A kind of parchment for book covers; a forrill.

verbs.description: forel (third-person singular simple present forels, present participle forelling, simple past and past participle forelled)

examples: As for Josephus's conceit , that the second edition of the temple by Zerubbabel , as it was new forelled and filleted with gold by Herod , was a statelier volume than the first of Solomon
